application.models

Class Screening

  • java.lang.Object
    • application.models.SuperModel
      • application.models.Screening

  • public class Screening
extends SuperModel
    Purpose:
    Screening class containing fields and methods pertaining to
    a single screening
    Description:
    Contains information about the screening in the form of String fields,
    a list of seats in the screening (with information on whether or not
    each seat is booked); along with getter methods and methods
    for managing the list of seats.
    Version:
    $Date: 2017/12/14 16:00:00 $
    Author:
    Zaid Al Lahham and Aleksi Anttila

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean checkSeat(java.lang.String seat)
      Checks if a given seat in the Screening is booked.
      java.time.LocalDateTime getDateTime()
      Gets the dateTime of the Screening (LocalDateTime)
      Film getFilm()
      Gets a reference to the Film object the Screening is for (from the filmList in Main)
      java.lang.String getFilmTitle()
      Gets the film title of the film the Screening is for.
      java.lang.String getScreeningID()
      Gets the ScreeningID of the Screening.
      java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Boolean> getSeats()
      Gets the list of seats for the screening, along with their booking status (true iff booked)
      int[] getTheatreDimensions()
      Gets the theatre dimensions for this Screening object as an integer array where the first element is the number of seat rows in the theatre, and the second is the number of seat columns.
      void updateSeats(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Boolean> seats)
      Given a list of seats in the Screening that are to be changed, updates the Screening's list of seats using the new list (all values corresponding to keys that are shared between the Screening's list and the new list are overwritten by the values in the new list, and all other values are left as they are.)

    • Constructor Detail

      • Screening

        public Screening(java.lang.String filmTitle,
                 java.time.LocalDateTime dateTime,
                 java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Boolean> seats)
        Constructor Sets the Screening's film title, datetime and seats list from the parameters, and constructs a screeningID from them
        Parameters:
        filmTitle - Film title String to be set
        dateTime - LocalDateTime to be set
        seats - A Hashmap; the key is a letter followed by a number (in the current version, "a1" to "d6"), and the value is true iff the seat is booked.

      • Screening

        public Screening(org.json.JSONObject screeningJSON)
        Constructor Given a JSONObject, sets the fields of the Screening object based on the corresponding key-value pairs in the JSONObject; parses the JSONObject and calls the constructor above.
        Parameters:
        screeningJSON - JSONObject for the screening containing the following keys: filmTitle, dateTime, seats; the seats object should consist of key(String)-value(boolean) pairs in the same fashion as the seats field

      • checkSeat

        public boolean checkSeat(java.lang.String seat)
        Checks if a given seat in the Screening is booked.
        Parameters:
        seat - The key for the seat to be checked
        Returns:
        True iff the seat is booked

      • updateSeats

        public void updateSeats(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Boolean> seats)
        Given a list of seats in the Screening that are to be changed, updates the Screening's list of seats using the new list (all values corresponding to keys that are shared between the Screening's list and the new list are overwritten by the values in the new list, and all other values are left as they are.)
        Parameters:
        seats - The seats list updating the Screening's seat list

      • getTheatreDimensions

        public int[] getTheatreDimensions()
        Gets the theatre dimensions for this Screening object as an integer array where the first element is the number of seat rows in the theatre, and the second is the number of seat columns. Assumes that the seat plan is a rectangle, and that the row index is a single character.
        Returns:
        A two-element integer array; the first element is the number of seat rows in the theatre, and the second is the number of seat columns.
